intro: Anchusa sartorii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Anchusa sartorii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in garden landscapes.
